instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
no water damage, no AWAKE no SLPS2R voltage , no short found.. no ssd voltage and not short.
replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> but the same..all 4 LDOs look o.k

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
So your problem is not in <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area.
Thinks more next time, before changing it.

Resolder f7000/1.
Post exact diode mode at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; check it in both directions to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
You should get higher reading in reverse way.
Check if any big coil gives you same actual readings.
